sentences.english: In the late summer, the rivers swell and often burst their banks.
sentences.chinese: 夏末，河流涨水，常常冲决河岸。

sentences.english: She bid me take life easy, as the grass grows on the weirs.
sentences.chinese: 当青草在河岸滋长的时候，她嘱咐我要轻松的去生活。

sentences.english: Their ship is bearing down on the shore.
sentences.chinese: 他们的船正向河岸疾驶。

sentences.english: On either side the river lie Long fields of barley and of rye.
sentences.chinese: 绵长的大麦与黑麦田伸延在河岸两旁。

sentences.english: The water has been on the same level with the banks.
She lay on the bank, listening to the ripple of the stream.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在河岸上，听着小河的潺潺流水声。

sentences.english: When the police hit the shore, they fled into the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 当警察到达河岸时，他们逃进了丛林。

sentences.english: Every morning the first thing Cheng does is exercise along the riverbank.
sentences.chinese: 每天早上他的第一项必修课就是沿着河岸做练习。

sentences.english: The bank of the Ganges welcomed me into its lap like a friend of a former birth.
sentences.chinese: 恒河河岸就像我前生前世的老友一样拥我入怀。

sentences.english: Along the river bank there is a hedge.
I stood guard with a rifle on the bank of the river.
sentences.chinese: 我拿着枪站在河岸上放哨。

sentences.english: Over the high banks, the cottage roofs and the tops of the bamboo clumps are visible.
sentences.chinese: 高高的河岸上，竹林梢头农舍的屋顶隐约可见。

sentences.english: Flocks of cranes fly up from the further river-bank and fitful gusts of wind rush over the heath.
sentences.chinese: 鹤群从远远的河岸飞起，狂风吹过常青的灌木。

sentences.english: They need holes in riverbanks to make nests.
sentences.chinese: 它们需要河岸上的洞穴去筑巢。

sentences.english: The rough rock walls were like the sides of a deep canal .
sentences.chinese: 凸凹不平的石墙就像一条很深的运河的河岸。

sentences.english: Flocks of cranes fly up from the further river-bank and fitful guests of wind rush over the heath.
sentences.chinese: 鹤群从远远的河岸飞起，狂风吹过常青的灌木。

definition: opposite bank (of a body of water)
edge of the water/waterside/shore (of sea, lake or river)
